title: Part D(ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a correct answer and/or a valid explanation.

  • The rate constant will increase. At higher temperature, a greater frequency of effective collisions will result in an increased probability of product formation, increasing the rate constant.

OR

  • The rate constant will increase. The rate law for the reaction is rate = k[HBr] MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGYbGaaeyyai aabshacaqGLbGaaGjbVlaab2dacaaMe8Uaae4AaiaabUfacaqGibGa aeOqaiaabkhacaqGDbaaaa@45BE@ (because [CH 3 CH 2 OH] MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGBbGaae4qai aabIeadaWgaaWcbaGaae4maaqabaGccaqGdbGaaeisamaaBaaaleaa caqGYaaabeaakiaab+eacaqGibGaaeyxaaaa@414F@ remains constant), so at the same concentration, the only way for the rate to increase is for the rate constant to increase.

The response provides a correct answer and a valid explanation.

  • The rate constant will increase. At higher temperature, a greater frequency of effective collisions will result in an increased probability of product formation, increasing the rate constant.

OR

  • The rate constant will increase. The rate law for the reaction is rate = k[HBr] MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGYbGaaeyyai aabshacaqGLbGaaGjbVlaab2dacaaMe8Uaae4AaiaabUfacaqGibGa aeOqaiaabkhacaqGDbaaaa@45BE@ (because [CH 3 CH 2 OH] MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGBbGaae4qai aabIeadaWgaaWcbaGaae4maaqabaGccaqGdbGaaeisamaaBaaaleaa caqGYaaabeaakiaab+eacaqGibGaaeyxaaaa@414F@ remains constant), so at the same concentration, the only way for the rate to increase is for the rate constant to increase.

descriptions:
